identificationModule.briefTitle: Clinical Study to Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of MLC601 in 150 Iranian Patients After Stroke

collaborators.name: Shahid Beheshti University of Medical Sciences

descriptionModule.briefSummary: To investigate the safety and efficacy of MLC601 (NeuroAideTM) as a Traditional Chinese Medicine on motor recovery after ischemic stroke.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: This is a double-blind, placebo-controlled clinical trial study on 150 patients with a recent (less than 3 month) ischemic stroke. All patients will give either MLC601 (100 patients) or placebo (50 patients), 4 capsules 3 times a day, as an add-on to standard medication of post stroke for 3 months. Motor improvement will be monitored using Fugl-Meyer Assessment FMA.

armGroups.label: MLC601
armGroups.description: MLC601 (NeuroAideTM) is a TCM which is used extensively in China to improve recovery after stroke. It combines several herbal and animal components.

interventions.name: MLC601
interventions.description: group A (100 patients; NeuroAid 400mg, 4 capsules 3 times daily) or for 3 month

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: group B (50 patients; placebo, 4 capsules 3 times daily) for 3 months

primaryOutcomes.measure: Investigate the Safety and Efficacy of MLC601
primaryOutcomes.description: Patients showed a good tolerability to treatment and adverse events were mild and transient.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Motor recovery of MLC601 in 150 Iranian Patients after Stroke
secondaryOutcomes.description: Repeated measured analysis showed statistically difference in Fugl-Meyer Assessment FMA score during 12 months between two groups

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* age between 30-72 yars,
* \< one month after stroke,
* ischemic cerebral stroke,
* signed informed consent form.

Exclusion Criteria:

* treatment with thrombolytic after stoke,
* ischemic stroke combined with hemorrhage, severe renal or liver failure, dementia, psychosis and history of seizure disorder, history of previous stroke, and hemoglobin level less than 10mg/dl on admission.
